trans-unit.source: Certificate profiles for resource access |Microsoft Intune
trans-unit.target: Certificate profiles for resource access |Microsoft Intune

trans-unit.source: Secure VPN, Wi-Fi, and email access with a certificate installed on each user device.
trans-unit.target: Secure VPN, Wi-Fi, and email access with a certificate installed on each user device.

trans-unit.source: Secure resource access with certificate profiles in Microsoft Intune
trans-unit.target: Secure resource access with certificate profiles in Microsoft Intune

trans-unit.source: When you give users access to corporate resources through VPN, Wi-Fi, or email profiles, you can secure the access by using a certificate that is installed on each user device.
trans-unit.target: When you give users access to corporate resources through VPN, Wi-Fi, or email profiles, you can secure the access by using a certificate that is installed on each user device.

trans-unit.source: Here's how it works:
trans-unit.target: Here's how it works:

trans-unit.source: Make sure you have the right certificate infrastructure in place, as described in [Configure certificate infrastructure for SCEP](configure-certificate-infrastructure-for-scep.md) and [Configure certificate infrastructure for PFX](configure-certificate-infrastructure-for-pfx.md).
trans-unit.target: Make sure you have the right certificate infrastructure in place, as described in [Configure certificate infrastructure for SCEP](configure-certificate-infrastructure-for-scep.md) and [Configure certificate infrastructure for PFX](configure-certificate-infrastructure-for-pfx.md).

trans-unit.source: Install a root certificate or an intermediate Certification Authority (CA) certificate on each device so that the device recognizes the legitimacy of your CA.
trans-unit.target: Install a root certificate or an intermediate Certification Authority (CA) certificate on each device so that the device recognizes the legitimacy of your CA.

trans-unit.source: To do this, create and deploy a **Trusted Certificate Profile**.
trans-unit.target: To do this, create and deploy a **Trusted Certificate Profile**.

trans-unit.source: When you deploy this profile, the devices that you manage with Intune will request and receive the root certificate.
trans-unit.target: When you deploy this profile, the devices that you manage with Intune will request and receive the root certificate.

trans-unit.source: You have to create a separate profile for each platform.
trans-unit.target: You have to create a separate profile for each platform.

trans-unit.source: The **Trusted Certificate Profile** is available for these platforms:
trans-unit.target: The **Trusted Certificate Profile** is available for these platforms:

trans-unit.source: iOS 8.0 and later
trans-unit.target: iOS 8.0 and later

trans-unit.source: Mac OS X 10.9 and later
trans-unit.target: Mac OS X 10.9 and later

trans-unit.source: Android 4.0 and later
trans-unit.target: Android 4.0 and later

trans-unit.source: Windows 8.1 and later
trans-unit.target: Windows 8.1 and later

trans-unit.source: Windows Phone 8.1 and later
trans-unit.target: Windows Phone 8.1 and later

trans-unit.source: Create certificate profiles so that devices request a certificate to be used for authentication of VPN, Wi-Fi, and email access, as described in [Configure Intune certificate profiles](configure-intune-certificate-profiles.md).
trans-unit.target: Create certificate profiles so that devices request a certificate to be used for authentication of VPN, Wi-Fi, and email access, as described in [Configure Intune certificate profiles](configure-intune-certificate-profiles.md).

trans-unit.source: You can create and deploy a **PKCS #12 (.PFX) Certificate Profile** *or* a **SCEP Certificate Profile** for devices running these platforms:
trans-unit.target: You can create and deploy a **PKCS #12 (.PFX) Certificate Profile** *or* a **SCEP Certificate Profile** for devices running these platforms:

trans-unit.source: iOS 8.0 and later
trans-unit.target: iOS 8.0 and later

trans-unit.source: Android 4.0 and later
trans-unit.target: Android 4.0 and later

trans-unit.source: Windows 10 (desktop and mobile) and later
trans-unit.target: Windows 10 (desktop and mobile) and later

trans-unit.source: Use a **SCEP Certificate Profile** for devices running these platforms:
trans-unit.target: Use a **SCEP Certificate Profile** for devices running these platforms:

trans-unit.source: Mac OS X 10.9 and later
trans-unit.target: Mac OS X 10.9 and later

trans-unit.source: Windows Phone 8.1 and later
trans-unit.target: Windows Phone 8.1 and later

trans-unit.source: You must create a separate profile for each platform.
trans-unit.target: You must create a separate profile for each platform.

trans-unit.source: When you create the profile, associate it with the **Trusted Root Certificate Profile** that you've already created.
trans-unit.target: When you create the profile, associate it with the **Trusted Root Certificate Profile** that you've already created.

trans-unit.source: If you don't have an Enterprise Certification Authority, you must create one.
trans-unit.target: If you don't have an Enterprise Certification Authority, you must create one.

trans-unit.source: If you decide, based on your device platforms, to use the Simplified Certificate Enrollment Protocol (SCEP) profile, you'll also need to configure a Network Device Enrollment Service (NDES) server.
trans-unit.target: If you decide, based on your device platforms, to use the Simplified Certificate Enrollment Protocol (SCEP) profile, you'll also need to configure a Network Device Enrollment Service (NDES) server.

trans-unit.source: Whether you plan to use SCEP or .PFX profiles, you must download and configure the Microsoft Intune Certificate Connector.
trans-unit.target: Whether you plan to use SCEP or .PFX profiles, you must download and configure the Microsoft Intune Certificate Connector.

trans-unit.source: Learn how to configure all of the required services in [Configure certificate infrastructure for SCEP](configure-certificate-infrastructure-for-scep.md) or [Configure certificate infrastructure for PFX](configure-certificate-infrastructure-for-pfx.md).
trans-unit.target: Learn how to configure all of the required services in [Configure certificate infrastructure for SCEP](configure-certificate-infrastructure-for-scep.md) or [Configure certificate infrastructure for PFX](configure-certificate-infrastructure-for-pfx.md).

trans-unit.source: Next steps
trans-unit.target: Next steps

trans-unit.source: Configure certificate infrastructure for SCEP
trans-unit.target: Configure certificate infrastructure for SCEP

trans-unit.source: Configure certificate infrastructure for PFX
trans-unit.target: Configure certificate infrastructure for PFX

trans-unit.source: Configure Intune certificate profiles
trans-unit.target: Configure Intune certificate profiles
